definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)

sentences.english: Not charioted by Bacchus and his pards.
sentences.chinese: 不用酒神坐文豹的車駕。

sentences.english: Close rear frame can prevent the inside of the compactor from entangling garbage.
sentences.chinese: 後車駕設計成封閉式，防止垃圾捲入機內而損壞機器。

sentences.english: In a campaign , Zhao Xuanzi's carriage crashed into the marching troops .
sentences.chinese: 一次戰役中，趙宣子的車駕衝撞了行進的隊伍。

sentences.english: Jack pulls into a crowded parking lot and gets out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 傑克將車駕入一個佈滿了車的停車場，從車內走出。

definition: to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to be in overall charge/to oversee
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to go on a hunting expedition
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to employ/to send for sb promising employment
